channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbreakingNews
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbreakingNews, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What is the price of silver today: February 5, 2026?
item.description: Considering a silver investment in today's economic climate? Here's where the price stands as of February 5, 2026.

item.title: WATCH: What to expect at the Winter Olympics
item.description: ABC News' Maggie Rulli speaks with U.S. Olympians about the excitement leading up to the games in Italy.

item.title: WATCH: Guthrie family releases new video as search for missing mother intensifies
item.description: The urgent search for Nancy Guthrie, the mother of "Today" show host Savannah Guthrie, has entered its fifth day, as her children continue to plead fo...

item.title: What to know about the congressional fight over ICE restrictions
item.description: Democrats say they're unified in forcing the issue amid public backlash.

item.title: Criminals plot to sack Super Bowl fans for a loss with these online scams
item.description: Lawmakers are warning Americans to beware the many financial scams linked to Super Bowl LX, from fake betting sites to counterfeit tickets.

item.title: Russia says huge meteorite chunk discovered before being smuggled to U.K.
item.description: Russia's customs service says a 2.8-ton chunk of the Aletai meteorite was found in a shipping container, labeled as a garden ornament.

item.title: WATCH: A priest with very happy feet
item.description: Father O of Pope Saint John Paul the Second Preparatory School dances to NSYNC's "Bye, Bye, Bye" for the school basketball game's halftime show.

item.title: Bio lab found in Las Vegas is similar to California scene, officials say
item.description: Officials in Reedley, California said they had tried to warn federal authorities about the possibility of similar labs after one was found there in 20...

item.title: Arizona Department of Public Safety helicopter crash kills pilot and trooper during shooter response
US job openings fall to 6.5M, fewest since 2020, as labor market remains sluggish
item.description: U.S. job openings fell to the lowest level in more than five years, another sign that the American labor market remains sluggish

item.title: Washington Post begins sweeping layoffs as it scales back news coverage
item.description: Former WaPo executive editor Martin Baron told CBS News the paper's coverage will be "dramatically diminished" because of the job cuts.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie posts message to her mother’s kidnapper asking to provide proof she is alive
Trump’s border czar is pulling 700 immigration officers out of Minnesota immediately
